intro: Massularia acuminata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features velvety, dark green leaves with a waxy texture and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. Massularia acuminata thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil.
